vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/84c2903c-93fa-4060-8151-908e41a7ebe0">WRITING MATERIALS</keyword>         <topcClas>Income, property and investment - Economics</topcClas>         <topcClas>Higher and further - Education</topcClas>         <topcClas>Housing</topcClas>         <topcClas>Social indicators and quality of life - Society and culture</topcClas>         <topcClas>Youth - Social stratification and groupings</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The main aims of the <i>Student Income and Expenditure 2011/12 Survey</i> were to: <ul><li>provide detailed information on the income, expenditure and debt levels of higher education (HE) students in England and Wales;</li><li>allow for analysis on larger and more memorable spending captured in the main questionnaire, as well as day-to-day spending recorded in the seven-day spending diary;</li><li>provide a baseline for assessing the impact of changes in student finance introduced in September 2012 for those starting HE in the 2012/13 academic year.</li></ul><br> Fieldwork was conducted between February 2012 and June 2012. Please see the User Guide accompanying the SIES 2011/12 dataset for further information.<br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The dataset contains data related to the following topics:<ul><li>Course details,</li><li>Background,</li><li>Fees,</li><li>Student attitudes and choices,</li><li>Higher Education-related income,</li><li>Overall financial position,</li><li>Other income sources (earnings, family, benefits, savings),</li><li>Commercial credit,</li><li>Expenditure.</li></ul><br> </abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate event="start" date="2012-02-01T00:00:00Z">February 2012</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="2012-06-01T00:00:00Z">June 2012</collDate>         <nation>England and Wales</nation>         <geogUnit>Unitary Authorities (England)</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>Unitary Authorities (Wales)</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>Greater London</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>English and Welsh domiciled undergraduate students (studying full-time or part-time) in English and Welsh HEIs.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Repeated cross-sectional study</timeMeth>         <dataCollector>NatCen Social Research</dataCollector>         <dataCollector>Institute for Employment Studies</dataCollector>         <sampProc>Multi-stage stratified random sample</sampProc>         <deviat>5,007 cases</deviat>         <collMode>Telephone interview; Diaries</collMode>         <collMode>Web-based survey</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>Weighting used.
